page.title: 12Hornsea Pottery (M)
page.content: One of the popular places in our area for visitors, is Hornsea Pottery. The site takes up about 42 acres and the whole complex employs about 200 people, (less in the winter). The factory opened in 1974 although the company started in Hornsea in Yorkshire in 1949. In the factory they make table ware such as tea sets, dinner plates and vases. People are employed mixing the clay, making the moulds and fettling the moulded pots by trimming off the rough edges. The pottery is fired in 36m long kilns to a temperature of 1140C. The pots are sent all over Britain and abroad, as far away as Australia. Visitors can go round the factory as well as a Rare Breeds Survival unit, Amusement Park and various other shops. They get about 5000 visitors on a good day.
